snippet: There has been a surge of interest in all things Austen since the 200th anniversary last year of the release of “Pride & Prejudice.”
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; artifacts of author Jane Austen are emerging from attics and storage, attracting collectors and visitors to museums and auctions, in wake of 200th anniversary of release of book Pride and Prejudice; two new antique shows, Brooklyn Antiques & Book Fair and NYC Big Flea Market, aim to attract New Yorkers looking for antiques to decorate their homes and develop obsessions with particular types of objects.
lead_paragraph: There has been a surge of interest in all things Austen since the 200th anniversary last year of the release of “Pride & Prejudice.”

headline.main: Jane Austen Artifacts at the Morgan Library and in England
headline.print_headline: Jane Austen Artifacts at the Morgan Library and in England
